p: Başer [ 9] claimed that octyl acetate (39.9%) was the main constituent, followed by 1-octanol (11.9%). Al-Harrasi [ 10] found limonene (33.5%) and ( E)-β-ocimene (32.2%) to be the predominant compounds in olibanum from B. sacra. Camarda et al. [ 6] also reported limonene to be the dominant substance, albeit at half the abundance found by Al-Harrasi (18.2%). Furthermore, Camarda identified α-pinene as the second most abundant substance (15.1%). Al-Saidi identified α-pinene as the main volatile component, followed by octyl acetate (13.4%) [ 11].
